poll_list.title: Ratify the Results of Grants Round 12 and Formally Request the Community Multisig to Payout Matching Allocations
poll_list.body:
We ask our Community Stewards to ratify the GR12 payout amounts as being correct, fair, and abiding to community norms, including the judgments and sanctions made by the Fraud Detection & Defense workstream.

For further info & final GR12 results, see this forum post.


Please vote FOR or AGAINST.
1. FOR: Ratify the round results
You ratify the results as reported by Gitcoin Holdings & the Fraud Detection & Defense workstream and request the keyholders of the community multisig to payout funds according to the GR12 final payout amounts through the non-custodial GR12 deployment contract.
2. AGAINST: Request further deliberation
You do not ratify the results and request keyholders of the community multi-sig wallet to delay payment until further notice.
poll_list.author: 0x0CF30daf2Fb962Ed1d5D19C97F5f6651F3b691c1

discourse_list.title: [Proposal] Ratify the Results of Grants Round 12 and Formally Request the Community Multisig Holders to Payout Matching Allocations

content.content: We ask our Community Stewards to ratify the GR12 payout amounts as being correct, fair, and abiding to community norms, including the judgments and sanctions made by the Fraud Detection & Defense workstream. We would like to suggest voting on Snapshot to begin on Wednesday, January 5th, in advance of payouts being made the week of January 10th.  Options to vote on: 1. Ratify the round results You ratify the results as reported by Gitcoin Holdings & the Fraud Detection & Defense workstream and request the keyholders of the community multisig to payout funds according to the GR12 final payout amounts through the non-custodial GR12 deployment contract. 2. Request further deliberation You do not ratify the results and request keyholders of the community multi-sig wallet to delay payment until further notice.  TLDR from the Results Post:   Grants Round 12 ran from Dec 1-16, 2021   GR12 was Gitcoin Grants’ largest round ever with $6.1M raised for public goods, representing 135% round-over-round growth vs. GR11’s $2.6M. Of the $6.1M raised in GR12, $3M came from the matching pool and $3.1M came from the community.   GR12 featured ten rounds:  The main round Six ecosystem rounds: Uniswap, Synthetix, ZKTech, Polygon, Forefront, Gitcoin Building Gitcoin (on dGrants) - not governed through the community multi-sig  Three cause rounds: Climate, Advocacy, Longevity    In GR12, we ran an experiment in the main round – having a single pool, rather than a category-based approach. Broadly speaking, this experiment was a success and the Public Goods Funding workstream plans to propose running more single pool rounds in the future.   In addition, GR12 saw a marked increase in side rounds – both ‘ecosystem rounds’ and ‘cause rounds’ – with side round matching funds accounting for double those of the main pool ($2M side rounds + $1M main pool). We’re excited about continuing on the momentum of these ecosystem & cause rounds in GR13.    Also see FDD GR12 Governance Brief for sybil detection overview For questions, comments, or concerns on any of the above, please comment below or join the Gitcoin Discord .
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to ratify the results of Grants Round 12 and requesting the community multisig holders to payout matching allocations. The post provides details about the Grants Round 12, including the amount raised, the rounds, and the success of the experiment. The post also suggests two options for voting and provides a link for further information. The post may be of interest to those who want to understand the Grants Round 12 and participate in the voting process.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Thanks for this clear overview & congratulations to all people at Gitcoin for making this such a tremendous success. No questions, just a yes vote and happy holidays to all.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: Update: Here are the final GR12 results. We apologize for the delay in posting the full results - we had some issues with our new squelching script that we had to work through. We will soon be moving this to a Snapshot vote for steward ratification.
